name: 周素鳳
objective:
This course aims to enhance students’ competence in English through reading short essays. The reading will cover a wide range of topics selected from books, newspaper and magazines.  Special emphasis will be put on vocabulary development, text summarization, and critical comprehension skills, such as identifying the main ideas and supporting details, recognizing context clues, drawing inferences and making critical judgments.
Objectives:
Students who ultimately achieve the learning goals of the course should be able to
• read challenging texts
• grasp the main ideas and supporting material
• formulate a personal response.
• analyze materials critically
•draw valid inferences and conclusions.

materials:
Requirements:
1.Your regular attendance is required to pass this course.
3 unexcused absences from class will result in failing for this
course.  Excused absences require that I be notified on or before
class date, or official documentation shortly after the absence.
One unexcused absence will result in an automatic final score
reduction of 3 points.  If you are more than 20 minutes late to
the class, it will be counted as an absence.  One late attendance
means a 1 point reduction from your final score.
2.  In addition to the vocabulary quiz given after each selected
text, there will be in-class activities (group discussion, or in-    class writing). If you fail to take the test or submit the
assignment by the end of the class, there is no way to make it
up (no exceptions).  However, two of your lowest score will be
dropped—so, save these for the unexpected occasions when you
might be sick or miss class for other reason.
3.  Every student will be arranged to take an individual oral test.
You will be asked to summarize the texts covered in class and
answer questions.  Every week, 8 students will be assigned to
take the oral test, while all the other students will be given
group activities, in-class practices in writing or translation
work.
